The 'Denver Nuggets' are a professional basketball team based in Denver,
Colorado that plays in the National Basketball Association. The team was founded
as the 'Denver Larks' in 1967 as a charter franchise of the American Basketball
Association (ABA) but changed its name to 'Rockets' before the first season. It
changed its name again to the Nuggets in anticipation of an ABA-NBA merger in
1974, and played for the final ABA Championship title in 1976, losing to the New
York Nets. The team joined the NBA in 1976 after the ABA-NBA merger and has had
some periods of success, making the playoffs for nine consecutive seasons in the
1980s and doing the same for the previous ten seasons. However, it has not made
an appearance in a championship round since its last year in the ABA.

The Nuggets play their home games at the Pepsi Center, which they share with the
Colorado Avalanche of the NHL.
